title: University Education Committee Instruction Letter(IPO-A330-01) | Yönerge
text: Instruction No IPO-A330-01V01 Effective Date 21-12-2021 Update Date 21-12-2021 Related Unit / Owner VP-E / Rektör Yardımcılığı - Eğitim Approved by BT / Board of Trustees Aim Coordinating SU's efforts in Education, ensuring the continuous improvement of practices and processes. Regulating the processes regarding relevant proposals from the Academic Units on legislation and academic practices. Scope This instruction letter covers the purpose, mission and working principles of the University Education Committee. Principle Sabancı University should determine the educational policies in accordance with its philosophy, principles and strategic objectives, ensure the effectiveness of its practices, and provide its students with an educational experience that will enable them to compete at the universal level. Statutory Basis Definitions / Abbreviations SU : Sabancı University BT : Board of Trustees UEC : University Education Committee BoD : University Executive Board AC : Academic Council VPE : Vice-President for Education CIAD : Center for Individual and Academic Development FDD : Foundations Development Directorate SL : School of Languages SR : Student Resources Regulations COMPOSITION Led by the Vice-President for Education, the committee consists of the Vice-Deans of the Faculties, CIAD Director, Foundations Development Director, SL Director, SR Director and Student Union Representative. During the discussion of the agenda items, the Education Committee may invite the relevant academic and administrative unit managers/related personnel to the UEC meeting to hear their opinions and suggestions, if necessary. FUNCTIONING Functioning of the UEC is described below. Vice-President for Education chairs the UEC. The committee meets regularly once a month . The frequency of the meetings may change according to the priority of the agenda, upon the call of the UEC Chair. Establishing the UEC agenda, making preparations for the meeting, being a reporter of the meeting, sharing the decisions with the relevant parties, guiding and coordinating relevant units regarding the tasks to be carried out, following up the developments and bringing the issues to the agenda of relevant higher boards, when necessary, are responsibilities of the VPE Office. Agenda of the meeting and the necessary preparations, if any, are sent to the members by the VPE Office at least one week before the meeting. The opinions of the committee are formed by the majority of the members attending the meeting. Meeting minutes and the details of the actions to be taken are shared with the responsible academic/administrative units by the VPE office within one week following the meeting date. UEC forms sub-committees/task forces, when it deems necessary. AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY Monitors the practices exemplified below regarding the education processes and makes the necessary arrangements. Makes recommendations to the relevant committees in the event that the issues requiring legislative change should be resolved or the authority for the decision belongs to different boards. The main areas of responsibility of the UEC are as follows: Reviewing, making suggestions and following the actions to be determined in order to reach the strategic objectives in education. Defining policies for education processes, making process designs, determining and following performance indicators, monitoring these in terms of efficiency and effectiveness. Examining the new practice proposals in education, which are caused by new legal regulations, that will affect the legislation (regulations, instruction letters, procedures, principles, etc.), presenting an opinion to the AC. Identifying areas of improvement in education processes, informing the relevant Academic and Administrative Units, working together to create an action plan. Examining the Academic Calendar prepared by the SR, in consultation with Faculties, for the new academic year, and presenting an opinion to the AC. Discussing the plans for new academic units, programs and practices (faculty, institute, program, etc.) and the revisions of existing ones, and submitting proposals to the AC. Developing projects that will bring innovation to teaching/learning methods and the training of educators. Discussing and coordinating the changes and innovations, which concern all Faculties and Institutes, regarding courses and program curricula. Periodically evaluating the following processes in order to create a continuous review cycle for the programs and to ensure their continuous monitoring (Quality Assurance Systems/Bologna Process/Accreditation). Learning and Program Outcomes Education Self-Evaluation Reports Evaluation/interpretation of student course evaluations, feedbacks of the graduating class and alumni.
